title: Shantha Bandara replaces Shasheendra Rajapaksa as the Agri promotion state minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Shantha Bandara replaces Shasheendra Rajapaksa, a cousin of Sri Lanka’s incumbent Rajapaksa family as the State Minister of paddy, Agri technology, cultivation and promotion amid growing public protest.

The replacement comes in following a growing mass-scale people’s protest on the island that’s calling for the government to quit for its incompetency in managing the country along with the rest of the 225 parliamentarians.
A protest near the President’s house on March 31 that turned violent, set off anti-governmental protests across the country is growing in numbers.
Bandara is a Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) parliament member representing the Kurunegala district.

He was sworn in on Monday (11) as the State Minister of Promoting the Production & Regulating the Supply of Organic Fertilizer, and Paddy and Grains, Organic Foods, Vegetables, Fruits, Chilies, Onion and Potato Cultivation & Promotion, Seed Production and Advanced Technology Agriculture, a statement from President’s media division said.
The statement also added that the President has declined the resignation letter of the Foreign Employment Promotion and Market Diversification State Minister Piyankara Jayaratne.
